about.title: About the tutor
about.body: I’m Teodoro Morcone, a math tutor in Zurich and founder of Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe. I specialise in building strong foundations, preparing students for Gymnasium, BMS, HMS, and FMS admissions, and providing continuous support in key secondary math topics. My approach blends step-by-step explanations, progressive practice sets, realistic mock exams, and weekly progress tracking. Lessons are available in German, Italian, and English, delivered exclusively online via Zoom.

items.question: How do reschedules and cancellations work?
items.answer: Gymnasium entrance exam prep sessions can be moved or cancelled free of charge up to 24 hours in advance. Late changes (< 24h) or no-shows are billed in full so that reserved slots remain available for other candidates.

items.question: What materials do you use?
items.answer: I blend proprietary practice sets, official Zurich education department papers, adaptive drills mapped to your diagnostic results, and annotated solution walk-throughs. All resources are shared digitally with versioned feedback.

items.question: Is tutoring exclusively online?
items.answer: Yes. Sessions run on Zoom with collaborative whiteboard work, breakout problem drills, and optional recordings of key solution frameworks so you can review afterwards.

items.question: How quickly do you respond to inquiries?
items.answer: Within 24 hours you receive proposed time slots, a mini goal analysis, and—if helpful—a prep sheet to complete before the diagnostic call.

items.question: What are the payment options?
items.answer: Pay securely via invoice or Stripe (card, Twint). Packages are settled before the first session; single lessons are due within 10 days of delivery.

items.question: How is personal data handled?
items.answer: Personal data is processed solely for lesson delivery in line with Swiss revDSG. Analytics and tracking scripts load only after your consent, and Zoom recordings require written approval.

items.question: Do you cover specific BMS/HMS/FMS components?
items.answer: Yes. I cover the full competency profile for BMS, BM2, HMS, and FMS, including quantitative reasoning, essay prompts, and full-length simulations scored against official rubrics.

sections.heading: 1. Scope
body: These terms and conditions govern the agreement between Teodoro Morcone, sole proprietorship “Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe” (the “Provider”), and clients booking mathematics tutoring services.
Different provisions apply only if confirmed in writing.

sections.heading: 2. Services & lesson format
body: Lessons are generally delivered online. The exact medium or location is agreed upon during booking.
Lesson content, scope, and objectives are defined during the consultation or booking process.

sections.heading: 3. Booking via Calendesk / contract formation
body: Appointments are scheduled through Calendesk. Once Calendesk confirms the booking, the contract is formed; Calendesk’s terms of use also apply.
Availability shown in the calendar may change. The Provider may decline a request or suggest alternatives.

sections.heading: 4. Pricing & payment via Stripe
body: Current prices are published on the website.
Payments are processed cashlessly via Stripe (e.g., card payments). Stripe’s terms apply in addition.
Invoices or receipts are provided electronically.

sections.heading: 5. Cancellation, rescheduling & no-shows
bullets: Sessions can be cancelled or rescheduled free of charge up to 24 hours before the start time.
Late cancellations, reschedules (< 24h), or no-shows are billed at 100% of the lesson price.
Should the client arrive late, the session still ends at the scheduled time; no additional time is owed.
If the Provider must cancel due to illness or unforeseen circumstances, prepaid fees are credited or an alternative appointment is offered.

sections.heading: 6. Client responsibilities
body: Clients ensure punctuality and an appropriate learning environment (for online lessons: stable internet connection plus functioning camera/microphone).
For minor learners, booking and consent must be provided by a parent or legal guardian.

sections.heading: 7. Lesson materials & copyright
body: Materials supplied by the Provider are protected by copyright and may be used only for personal learning.
Sharing or publishing the materials without permission is prohibited.

sections.heading: 8. Liability
body: Tutoring provides learning support; no guarantee is given for specific grades or exam results.
Statutory liability for wilful misconduct or gross negligence remains unaffected.

sections.heading: 9. Withdrawal / refunds
body: There is no statutory right of withdrawal for tutoring services already delivered.
Refunds follow clause 5 or apply if the Provider cancels (see clause 5.4).

sections.heading: 10. Governing law & jurisdiction
body: Swiss substantive law applies.
Jurisdiction is Zurich, Switzerland.

sections.heading: 11. Changes to these terms
body: The Provider may amend these terms at any time.
The version published at the time of booking applies.
